description: Celeriac is an amazing plant species that packs a hearty crunch and a unique flavor. Native to the Mediterranean region, celeriac is grown for its root, which is celery-like in taste and aroma but milder with an earthier flavor. The round, knobbly root has thick brown skin that must be peeled before consumption. Not only is celeriac delicious as a vegetable side dish, but it can also be used in stews, soups, and casseroles, making it a truly versatile cooking ingredient. When roasted, celeriac has a smoky, nutty taste, to which few ingredients can compare. Moreover, celeriac is packed with vitamins and minerals, making it a great addition to any healthy meal.
